Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gr1mB3an> 39 981 198 (48.00%) is this correct cir supply?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> Pretty much. Yet, a lot should still be time locked.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gr1mB3an> I see. How much is timelocked?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> Hard to know exact amount without going through the whole chain. Early rewards above 192 vrsc were time locked to be "randomly" released the following 2 years.  *"During the first 5 months, Verus will have an accelerated reward curve for mining and staking, with a halving every month. During the first two months, when the block rewards are at or above 192 Verus, mined blocks will have time locked coinbase transactions, preventing spending, staking, or transferring of those coins for a period that varies from approximately 3 months after the genesis block, based on numbers of blocks, to 2 years and 3 months."*
VisionPaper, page 21, <https://veruscoin.io/downloads/papers/VerusVision.pdf>

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> I think the fork was premature, I think announcing this board for the bounty was as well. As far as I know they have not received the bounty, but they profited from the announcement but have yet to deliver

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> I stand by the fork and don't think it was a overreaction. I believe we'd be worse off if it continued. Other than that I agree that preordering anything is really risky, and their time estimates have been way off, but I see nothing wrong in keeping an open mind about which board to use. It should be the same fpga chip and their supplier is said to be ready to ship either way. That's my interpretation.
